extracted_text:
As of August 22, 2025, Eternal Ltd. had two significant corporate developments: the establishment of a new subsidiary, Blinkit Foods, and a large volume of stock options exercised by company executives .

New subsidiary established

Executive stock options cashed out

Eternal (the parent company of Zomato and Blinkit) announced on August 22, 2025, that it would launch a new subsidiary called Blinkit Foods.

The new unit will focus on a 10-minute food delivery service under its "Bistro" brand.

Initial operations will involve 38 kitchens in the Bengaluru and Delhi-NCR areas.

Following the release of the company's Q1 FY26 results in July, over 142 executives exercised stock options between late July and mid-August.

This activity involved more than 1.3 crore shares, valued at around ₹420 crore.

The exercise of options was dominated by Blinkit executives, with CEO Albinder Dhindsa converting 70 lakh shares alone.
